history.content: You don't need to take STAT 140 after CS 70. It'd be a smarter choice to take EE 126 after CS 70

children.subject: if youre up to it (you have the linalg knowledge) id say 100% it is helpful

2nd perspective: I agree with above that stat140 may not be needed after 70 but tbh, the way 70 rushed through a lot of topics and just force fed you topic after topic so rapidly, Im in 140 right now and I understand the stuff we did in 70 so much better. I hate probability and always have, but I really appreciate the way 140 teaches the stuff to you, and the pace, great textbook, and Adhikari as professor really helped me grill in some topics that I feel better about my probability background going into 189 in a future semester. If you feel like you got everything out of 70, then there's no need for this class, but 70 wasn't my thing and 140 definitely helped fill in a lot of gaps. ymmv though. Hope this helps

Thank you! That's great advice. I haven't actually taken 70 or 140 yet, so my question was kind of asking about both at the same time. But this is still really good advice. I'll probably try both out for the first few weeks, and maybe drop one if it's too much.

Do you think it's helpful to take both of them together? I've heard 1st half of 140 helps with 2nd half of 70, but is it feasible in terms of workload / difficulty, barring that I've only taken Data 8 before?

history.content:
Intended CS or DS freshman here. Do you guys think it is feasible to take both 70 and 140 in one semester (given I've taken 61A 16A & Data 8 this sem)? I plan on taking 2 other light classes to balance this out, but I've heard mixed reviews about the combination. I've heard some say it is helpful to take both at the same time since the second half of 70 covers 140 content. But, I've also heard that both are high workload classes with weekly, difficult problem sets.

I kind of want to take 140 earlier than later so it will eventually prep me for 189 down the line, and I feel like any help towards the probability portion of 70 would be helpful, but do you think this combo is more beneficial or detrimental?

--------------------------------

EDIT: I realize that @13586 has info regarding similar topic, but I kind of what to know how workload / difficulty of both of these together would be like.
history.subject: CS 70 + Prob 140
